Class Connect4Game

java.lang.Object
  Connect4Game

public class Connect4Game
extends java.lang.Object

The data structure for a game of Connect 4. Connect4Game is made of a certain number of Connect4Columns. Each column represents a column from the current state of the game. You should not modify this class, but you will need to use methods within it.

          Copy an existing Connect 4 game.

          Construct a new Connect 4 game with the given size.

boardFull

public boolean boardFull()
Check if the board is full. Your agent will not need to use this method.

Returns:

public void clearBoard()
Start a new game. Your agent will not need to use this method.

gameWon

public char gameWon()
Check if the game has been won. Your agent will not need to use this method.

Returns:
'R' if red won, 'Y' if yellow won, 'N' if the game has not been won.

getBoardMatrix

public char[][] getBoardMatrix()
Retrieve a matrix form of the board. Your agent will not need to use this method.

Returns:
a character matrix of the game board.

Parameters:
i - The column to retrieve.
Returns:
the ith Connect4Column if it exists; null otherwise

the number of columns in the game board.

getRedPlayedFirst

public boolean getRedPlayedFirst()
Check whether red played first. This is used to confirm the players are alternating correctly. Your agent will not need to use this method.

Returns:
true if red played first in this game, false otherwise.

getRowCount

the number of rows in the game board.
